ARABIC: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But Musa threw down his staff and at once it swallowed up what they had fabricated.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then Moses threw down his staff, and lo, it swallowed up their conjurations.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Thereafter, Moses threw down his rod and behold, it went about swallowing up all the false devices they had contrived.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Then Moses cast down his staff and suddenly it swallowed up what they had falsely invented.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Therefore Moosa put forth his staff – so it immediately began swallowing all their fabrications.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then Musa threw his stick, and behold, it swallowed up all that they falsely showed!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then Musa cast down his staff and lo! it swallowed up the lies they told.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Then Moses cast his staff and lo, it forthwith swallowed up their lying invention;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then Moses threw his staff and lo! it swallowed that which they did falsely show.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Then Moses threw down his staff, and it swallowed up all that they had conjured into being.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then Musa cast down his staff, and lo! it swallowed up that which they had devised.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Thereat Moses threw down his staff, and behold, it was swallowing what they had faked.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then Moses threw his rod, when, behold, it straightway swallows up all the falsehoods which they fake!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then Musa (Moses) threw his stick, and behold, it swallowed up all the falsehoods which they showed!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Then Moses cast down his staff and it swallowed up their lying invention,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then Moses threw his staff, and behold, it began swallowing their trickery.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it devoured what they falsified.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:45] Thereat Moses cast his staff and lo! it was swallowing (talqafu: one of the original two tā’ letters [of taltaqifu] has been assimilated) what they had faked, [what they had] transformed through illusion, making their ropes and staffs appear to be moving serpents.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then Moses threw his staff and lo! it swallowed that which they did falsely show) of wizardry.
